column4: Microsoft urges US court to block warrant for emails held abroad
column5: NEW YORK Microsoft Corp asked a federal appeals court on Wednesday to block the U.S. government from forcing the company to hand over a customer's emails stored on an Irish server  warning that the precedent would create a "global free-for-all" that eviscerates personal privacy.

column4: Microsoft urges US court to block warrant for emails held abroad
column5: NEW YORK  Sept 9 Microsoft Corp asked a federal appeals court on Wednesday to block the U.S. government from forcing the company to hand over a customer's emails stored on an Irish server  warning that the precedent would create a "global free-for-all" that eviscerates personal privacy.
